alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:11PM CDT until March 31 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River At Montgomery affecting Autauga, Elmore, Dallas, Montgomery and Lowndes Counties. Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam affecting Dallas, Lowndes and Autauga Counties. Alabama River At Selma affecting Dallas County. .Flooding continues on the Alabama River and a flood warning remains in effect. The Alabama River at Selma is forecast to crest just below moderate flood stage. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 109.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 124.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
